source_sentence: 佛說大意經
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra

source_sentence: 宋天竺三藏求那跋陀羅譯
translation: Song Dynasty Translation of the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Guanabhadra

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園，與千二百五十比丘俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Sāvatthī, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「昔有國名歡樂無憂，王號曰廣慈哀。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, there was a country named happy and without sorrow in which the king's name was Guang compassion.

source_sentence: 國有居士名摩訶檀，妻名栴陀，生一子姿容端正世間少雙，墮地便語，
translation: In the kingdom there was a householder named Mahāprajāpatīta, whose wife’s name was Candra. She gave birth to a son with an elegant appearance like that of a sparrow in the world. He fell to the ground and said:

source_sentence: 便誓願言：『我當布施天下，救濟人民。
translation: They then made a vow, saying, 'I will give alms to the world and save its people.'

source_sentence: 其有孤獨貧窮者，我當給護令得安隱。』
translation: If there are those who are orphaned and poor, I will provide protection so they'll attain peace.'

source_sentence: 父母因名為大意，見其有異姿不與人同，恐是天龍鬼神，欲行卜問。
translation: Because of this, his parents called him Daiyi and saw that he had a different appearance but not the same as others. Fearing that he was a heavenly dragon or ghost, they wanted to perform divinatory inquiries.

source_sentence: 大意知之便報言：『我自是人，非天、龍、鬼、神也。
translation: Knowing this, Mahāprajāpatī replied, 'I myself am a human being, not a god, dragon, ghost, or deity.'

source_sentence: 但念天下人民窮厄者，欲護視之耳。』
translation: They simply think of the people in the world who are in distress and want to protect their ears.'

source_sentence: 說此意，便止不復語。
translation: When he said this, he stopped speaking and didn't say anything further.

source_sentence: 至年十七，乃報父母言：『我欲布施，勤苦人令得安隱。』
translation: When he was seventeen years old, he reported to his parents, saying, 'I want to give alms so that those who are suffering will attain peace.'

source_sentence: 「父母念言：『子初生時，已有是願。』
translation: The parents thought, 'When the child was first born, they already had this vow.'

source_sentence: 便告子言：『吾財無數，自恣意所施與，不相禁制也。』
translation: He then told his son, 'My possessions are countless, and I'll give them as freely as I wish without mutual restraints.'

source_sentence: 大意報言：『父母財物雖多，猶不足我用，唯當入海採七寶，以給施天下人民耳。』
translation: The great man replied, 'Although my parents have a lot of possessions, they still aren't enough for me to use, so I'll simply go into the ocean to gather seven treasures and give them to the people of the world.'

source_sentence: 數言如是，父母即聽使行。
translation: He repeatedly said so, and his parents listened to the messenger's actions.

source_sentence: 「大意便作禮，辭行入海，道經他國。
translation: “Mahayana then paid homage, departed, entered the sea, and passed on to another country.

source_sentence: 國中有婆羅門財富無量，見大意光顏端正，甚悅樂之，告言：『我相敬重，
translation: In that country there was a brahman of immeasurable wealth. Seeing Mahāprajñāpradīpa’s handsome countenance, he delighted and said to him, “I hold you in great esteem.

source_sentence: 今有小女欲以相上，願留止此。』
translation: Now, there's a young woman who wants to place her on top of him, so please stay here.'

source_sentence: 大意報言：『我辭家入海欲採七寶，未敢相許，且須來還。』
translation: The great man replied, 'I left home and went into the ocean to gather seven treasures, but I won't dare to give them up; I must come back.'

source_sentence: 於是遂進採得七寶，即遣人持寶還其本國，轉復到海際求索異物。
translation: He then proceeded to gather the seven treasures and sent someone to return to his native country with the treasures, going back to the seaside to search for a strange object.

source_sentence: 忽見一大樹高八十由延、廣亦八十由延，大意便上樹，遙見一銀城，宮闕、殿舍皆是白銀，
translation: Suddenly he saw a large tree, eighty yojanas high and also eighty yojanas in width. Then Mahāprajāpatī ascended to the top of the tree and saw from a distance a silver castle, which was made of white silver. The palaces and halls were all made of white silver.

source_sentence: 天女侍側妓樂自然。
translation: The heavenly maidens' attendants are naturally accompanied by music and courtesies.

source_sentence: 有一毒蛇繞城三匝，見大意便舉頭視之，大意自念言：『人為毒所害者，
translation: There was a poisonous snake that circumambulated the city three times. Seeing Mahāprajāpatī, Mahāprajāpatī raised his head and looked at it. Mahāprajāpatī thought to himself:

source_sentence: 皆由無善意故耳。』
translation: It's all because there's no good intention.'

source_sentence: 便坐，思須自思惟定意，須臾頃，蛇即低頭睡臥。
translation: He then sat down and reflected on his own thoughts of concentration, and in a moment the snake bowed its head to sleep and lay down.

source_sentence: 「大意欲入城，守門者便入白王言：『外有賢者欲見於王。』
translation: Desiring to enter the city with great intention, the gatekeeper enters and says to the king, 'There's a good man outside who wants to see the king.'

source_sentence: 王身自出迎之歡喜而言：『唯願仁者，留住此一時三月，得展供養。』
translation: The king came out and greeted him with joy, saying, 'Please, my lord, let me stay here for three months at a time to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 答言：『我欲行採寶，不宜久留。』
translation: He replied, 'I want to go and gather treasure; it's not advisable for me to stay long.'

source_sentence: 王報言：『我不視國事，唯願留住。』
translation: The king replied, 'I don't look after national affairs; I simply wish to stay.'

source_sentence: 大意便止留。
translation: Great idea then stopped and stayed.

source_sentence: 王即供設衣服、飲食、妓樂、床臥之具，乃歷九十日竟，大意辭王欲去，
translation: For ninety days the king prepared clothing, food and drink, music and dance performances, seats and bedding for the assembly. Then, after ninety days had passed, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī wished to depart.

source_sentence: 王便取珍琦七寶欲以送之，大意言：『我不多用是七寶，聞王有一明月珠，
translation: The king then took the rare and precious seven-jeweled treasures and wanted to give them to him. He said, “I don’t need these seven jewels very much. I have heard that the king has a bright moon necklace.

source_sentence: 意欲求之。』
translation: I want to ask for it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『我不惜是珠，但恐道路艱嶮難，以自隨耳。』
translation: The king said, 'I won't spare this pearl; I'm afraid the path will be difficult and dangerous, so I'll follow it.'

source_sentence: 大意言：『夫福之將，人不畏艱嶮。』
translation: The great idea is, 'The general of merit, people aren't afraid of the difficulty and danger.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此珠有二十里中寶隨之，便以貢於仁者，在意所欲；
translation: The king said, “Twenty li away from this jewel the treasure follows you.

source_sentence: 若後得道，願為弟子得給供養，踰於今日也。』
translation: If you later attain enlightenment, I'd like to make offerings for my disciples, which are more than today.'

source_sentence: 大意便受珠，歡喜而去。
translation: Great thought then accepted the pearl, rejoiced, and departed.

source_sentence: 「於是，大意轉前行見一金城。
translation: “Thereupon, Mahāprajāpatī saw a golden city in front of him.

source_sentence: 宮闕、殿舍皆是黃金，七寶之樹自然音樂，天女、侍從轉倍於前；
translation: The palace and the halls were all made of gold. The seven-jeweled trees naturally played music, and the heavenly maidens and attendants doubled in number before them.

source_sentence: 亦有毒蛇繞城六匝，見大意便舉頭視之，復坐定意，蛇復低頭而臥。
translation: Also, there was a poisonous snake that circled the city six times. Seeing Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, he raised his head to look at it and sat down in meditation. The snake again lowered its head and lay down.

source_sentence: 大意欲入城，守門者即入白王，王即出迎與相見，請前語言：『願留一時三月，
translation: When Mahāprajāpatī wished to enter the city, the gatekeeper said to the king, “May I stay for one night and three months.

source_sentence: 展於供養。』
translation: It's spread out as an offering.'

source_sentence: 大意便止留，王即待遇，施設飲食、衣服、天女、眾妓以娛樂之。
translation: The king arranged food, drink, clothing, heavenly maidens, and various kinds of courtesans to entertain them.

source_sentence: 乃歷六十日辭王欲去，王守請使留，其意不樂止，遂辭王而去。
translation: After sixty days he left the king’s palace and wished to depart. The king who was in charge of the monastery invited him to stay, but he did not wish to do so. So he departed.

source_sentence: 王復取珍琦七寶以送之，大意不肯受，告言：『我不樂眾寶，聞王有一明月珠，
translation: The king again took some rare treasures and seven kinds of treasures to offer them to the prince, but he refused to accept them with a big heart. He said, “I do not delight in all kinds of treasures. I have heard that the king has a bright moon-jewel.

source_sentence: 願以相惠。』
translation: May it be because of the mutual benefit of each other.'

source_sentence: 王言：『不敢愛之，但恐道遠且嶮難，以自隨耳。』
translation: The king said, 'I won't dare to love it; I'm afraid the path will be long and dangerous, so I'll follow it.'

source_sentence: 報言：『夫福之所，將何有難嶮？』
translation: He replied, 'There's no difficulty in going to the place of merit?'

source_sentence: 王即報言：『此珠有四十里中珍寶追之，便以貢上仁者，願後得道為弟子，
translation: The king replied, “There are treasures forty li in this jewel that I wish to chase after you.

source_sentence: 神足無比，得展供養過於今日。』
translation: Their spiritual abilities are incomparable, and they'll be able to make offerings more numerous than today.'

source_sentence: 便歡喜受珠而去。
translation: They then rejoiced, accepted the pearl, and departed.

source_sentence: 「於是，大意轉前行，復見一水精城。
translation: “Thereupon, Mahāprajāpatīya then proceeded forward and saw another city of water spirits.

source_sentence: 宮闕、殿舍、皆是水精，七寶之樹自然音樂，天女侍從轉倍於前；
translation: The palace and the halls were all made of water spirits. The seven-jeweled trees naturally played music, and the attendant heavenly maidens doubled in number before them.

source_sentence: 亦有一毒蛇繞城九匝，見大意即復舉頭視之。
translation: There was also a poisonous snake that circled the city nine times, and when he saw Mahāprajāpatī, he raised his head again to look at it.

source_sentence: 大意即復坐，深自思惟入定，蛇即復低頭睡臥。
translation: Great idea then resumed his seat and deeply contemplated entering concentration, and the snake again lowered its head to sleep and lay down.

source_sentence: 大意欲進時，守門者入白王，王即出迎，請前語言：『願留一時三月。』
translation: When Mahāprajāpatī wanted to enter, the gatekeeper entered to tell the king, and the king went out to meet him, inviting him to come forward and say, 'May I stay here for three months?'

source_sentence: 大意即留。
translation: The great idea is to stay.

source_sentence: 王復盡意供養，施設飲食、衣服、妓樂以娛樂之，乃歷四十日，即復辭王去。
translation: The king then offered food and drink, clothing, and music and entertained them with all kinds of entertainment. After forty days had passed, the prince departed again.

source_sentence: 王便取珍琦七寶欲以送之，大意不受，報言：『我不用是眾寶，聞王有一明月珠，
translation: The king then took the rare treasures of the seven kinds of treasures and wished to give them to him, but he did not accept them with a big heart.

source_sentence: 願以相惠。』
translation: May it be because of the mutual benefit of each other.'

source_sentence: 王便報言：『此珠有六十里中寶追之，便以上仁者，若後得道，願為弟子智慧無比，
translation: The king replied, “This jewel is sixty li in diameter and the treasures chase after it.

source_sentence: 當復供養，過於今日。』
translation: I'll make another offering, which is more than today.'

source_sentence: 便受珠歡喜而去。
translation: He then accepted the pearl, rejoiced, and departed.

source_sentence: 「於是，大意轉前行，復見一琉璃城。
translation: “Thereupon, Mahāprajāpatīya then proceeded forward and saw another lapis lazuli city.

source_sentence: 宮闕、殿舍皆是琉璃，七寶之樹自然音樂，天女侍從轉倍於前；
translation: The palace and the halls were all made of lapis lazuli. The seven-jeweled trees naturally played music, and the celestial maidens attended them even more frequently than before.

source_sentence: 亦見一毒蛇繞城十二匝，見大意便舉頭視之，大意即復坐，深思惟入定，
translation: He also saw a poisonous snake circling the city twelve times. When he saw Mahāprajāpa again, he raised his head to look at it. Mahāprajāpa sat down and meditated deeply on entering concentration.

source_sentence: 蛇復低頭睡臥。
translation: The snake then lowered its head and fell asleep.

source_sentence: 大意欲進，時守門者入白王，王出迎，請前乞留一時三月，大意即留。
translation: When Mahāprajāpatī wished to proceed, the gatekeeper entered to report to the king. The king came out to greet him and begged him to remain [in the palace] for three months.

source_sentence: 王身自供養飲食、衣服、妓樂以娛樂之，乃歷二十日辭王欲去。
translation: The king himself provided food, drink, clothing, and music to entertain them. Twenty days later he left the king’s household and wished to depart.

source_sentence: 王即取珍琦七寶以送之，大意不受其珍寶，言：『我聞王有一明月珠，
translation: The king then took some rare treasures and seven kinds of gems to offer them to the prince. Not accepting the precious gems with a big heart, he said, “I have heard that the king has a bright moon-rattled necklace.

source_sentence: 願以相惠。』
translation: May it be because of the mutual benefit of each other.'

source_sentence: 王報言：『此珠有八十里中珍寶追之，便以上於仁者，願後得道時，我為弟子淨意供養，
translation: The king replied, “There are eighty li in the distance of this jewel. If you chase after it with precious treasures, I wish to offer it to you as an offering by my disciples and pure intent so that you may attain enlightenment later.” The prince said:

source_sentence: 過於今日，令長得智慧。』
translation: Beyond today, I'll cause you to attain wisdom for a long time.'

source_sentence: 大意便受珠，歡喜而去。
translation: Great thought then accepted the pearl, rejoiced, and departed.

source_sentence: 「大意念言：『吾本來求寶，今已如志，當從是還。』
translation: Great intention is to think, 'I originally sought treasure, but now I've done as I wished, and I'll return from here.'

source_sentence: 便尋故道欲還本國，經歷大海，海中諸神王因共議言：『我海中雖多眾珍名寶，
translation: He then proceeded on his way back to his native land and crossed the great ocean. The deva kings in the sea said among themselves, “Even though there are so many rare treasures and renowned jewels in our ocean,

source_sentence: 無有如此輩珠。』
translation: There's no such group of pearls.'

source_sentence: 便勅使海神要奪其珠。
translation: He then ordered an envoy to the sea gods to snatch the pearl.

source_sentence: 神便化作人，與大意相見，問言：『聞卿得琦異之物，寧可借視之乎？』
translation: The god then transformed himself into a human being and met with Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, who asked, 'Have you heard that you've obtained something strange? How could you borrow it to look at it?'

source_sentence: 大意舒手示其四珠，海神便搖其手，使珠墮水中。
translation: Mahāprajāpatī extended his hand and showed him the four pearls, and the sea god shook his hand so that the pearl would fall into the water.

source_sentence: 大意念言：『王與我言時，但道此珠難保。
translation: Great thought occurred to him: When the king agreed with me, he merely told me that it would be difficult to keep this jewel.

source_sentence: 我幸已得之，今為此子所奪，非趣也。』
translation: Fortunately, I've already obtained it, but now that it's been taken away by this child, it's not a destination.'

source_sentence: 即謂海神言：『我自勤苦，經涉嶮岨得此珠來，汝反奪我今不相還，我當抒盡海水耳。』
translation: He then said to the sea god, 'I myself have suffered so much pain that I've crossed a precipice and found this pearl coming; why don't you snatch it away from me now?

source_sentence: 海神知之，問言：『卿志何高乃爾？
translation: Knowing this, the sea god asked, 'What's your high intention?'

source_sentence: 海深三百三十六萬由延，其廣無涯，奈何竭之。
translation: The sea is three hundred and thirty-six million yojanas deep and endlessly wide.

source_sentence: 譬如日終不墮地，大風不可攬束；
translation: It is as if the sun does not fall on the earth at all, and a great wind cannot hold it.

source_sentence: 日尚可使墮地，風尚可攬束，大海水終不可抒令竭也。』
translation: The sun can still cause it to fall to the ground, and the wind can still embrace it, but the great ocean water can't be exhausted by lying down.'

source_sentence: 大意笑答之，言：『我自念前後受身生死壞積其骨，過於須彌山，其血流，
translation: Mahāprajāpatī replied with a smile, saying: I am aware that the flesh of my former and latter bodies was subject to births and deaths. Their bones accumulated more than Mount Sumeru; their blood flowed like streams.

source_sentence: 五河四海未足以喻。
translation: The five rivers and four seas aren't enough to be a metaphor.

source_sentence: 吾尚欲斷是生死之根本，但此小海何足不抒？』
translation: I still want to stop it as the root of birth and death, but what's the point of not lying down in this small ocean?'

source_sentence: 復說言：『我憶念昔，供養諸佛，誓願言：「令我志行勇於道決所向無難。」
translation: Again, he said, 'Remembering the past, I'll make offerings to the buddhas and vows, saying, It won't be difficult for me to become determined and courageous in the path of resolute dedication.'

source_sentence: 當移須彌山、竭大海水，終不退意。』
translation: I'll move Mount Sumeru and the great ocean of water, never retreating from it.'

source_sentence: 便一其心，以器抒海水。
translation: They then concentrated their minds and poured the water of the ocean into a vessel.

source_sentence: 精誠之感達於第一四天，王來下，助大意抒水，三分已抒其二。
translation: His sincerity reached the first four heavens, where the king came down to help Mahāprajāpauṇḍa pour water, and after three-thirds had been poured, he did so for two.

source_sentence: 於是海中諸神王皆大振怖，共議言：『今不還其珠者，非小故也，水盡泥出，
translation: The kings of the gods in the sea became greatly fearful and said together, “If you do not return the gem to me now, it will not be small. Water will run out and mud will emerge.

source_sentence: 子便壞我宮室。』
translation: Your son will then destroy my palace.'

source_sentence: 海神便出眾寶以與大意，大意不取，告言：『不用是輩，但欲得我珠耳，
translation: The sea goddess then produced all the treasures and gave them to Mahāprajāpatī. Mahāprajāpatī didn't take them, but told her, 'There's no need for this group of people; they simply want to get my earrings.

source_sentence: 促還我珠，終不相置也。』
translation: They'll urge me to return my pearl, and they won't put it away.'

source_sentence: 海神知其意感，便出珠還之。
translation: Knowing what they thought, the sea gods produced the pearl and returned it.

source_sentence: 「大意得珠，過取婆羅門女，還其本國恣意大布施。
translation: “Mahayana obtained the pearl, took the Brāhmaṇa woman, returned to her native land, and gave it freely as a great gift.

source_sentence: 自是之後，境界無復飢寒窮乏者，四方士民皆去其舊土襁負歸仁。
translation: Since then, there's no hunger or cold or poverty in the realm, and the people of the four directions all leave their old land and return to benevolence.

source_sentence: 如是布施歷載，恩逮蜎飛，蚑行蠕動靡不受潤。
translation: Thus, this kindness of generosity has been given for years, and it's not nourished by the kindnesses that are acquired or fleeing, nor by crude actions or writhing.

source_sentence: 其後壽終，上為帝釋，或下為飛行皇帝。
translation: At the end of his life, he'll be reborn as a emperor or a flying emperor.

source_sentence: 積累功德，自致成佛三界特尊，皆由宿行，非自然也。」
translation: They accumulate merits that will themselves become buddhas in the three realms and be especially honored, all because of past actions, not naturally.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「大意者，我身是；
translation: The Buddha said to the bhikṣus: “O Mahāprajāpaṇḍika, this is me.

source_sentence: 時居士摩訶檀者，今現悅頭檀是；
translation: The householder Mahāprstivāda of that time is now the present joyful sandalwood.

source_sentence: 時母栴陀者，今現夫人摩耶是；
translation: The goddess of that time was Maya, who is now my wife.

source_sentence: 時歡樂無憂國王者，即摩訶迦葉是；
translation: This was Mahākāśyapa, the king of the happy and peaceful land at that time.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門女者，俱夷是；
translation: The brāhmaṇa maidens of that time were Kuśinagara.

source_sentence: 時女父者，彌勒是；
translation: The father of the daughter at that time was Maitreya.

source_sentence: 時銀城中王者，阿難是也；
translation: The king of the silver city at that time was Ānanda.

source_sentence: 時金城中王者，目犍蘭是；
translation: The king in the golden city at that time was Maudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 時水精城中王者，舍利弗是也；
translation: Śāriputra was the king of the water spirit city at that time.

source_sentence: 時琉璃城中王者，比丘須陀是也；
translation: The king of the lapis lazuli city at that time was the bhikṣu Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 時第四天王助大意抒海水者，即優陀是也；
translation: The fourth celestial king at that time was Udra, the one who assisted Mahayana in drying up the water of the ocean.

source_sentence: 時奪其珠者，即調達是也；
translation: The one who occasionally snatched the pearl was Sadāparibhūta.

source_sentence: 時四城門守者，即須颰、般特、蘇曷披、拘留是；
translation: The four guardians of the city gates at that time were Sudarśana, Panthaka, Supratiṣṭhita, and Krakucchanda.

source_sentence: 時繞四城毒蛇者，即是共殺酸陀利四臣是也。」
translation: Those who circumambulate the four cities at that time with poisonous snakes are the four ministers who killed Sodhārī together.

source_sentence: 阿難整衣服作，禮白佛言：「是時，大意以何功德，乃致是四寶城，處處得供養？
translation: Ānanda dressed himself in proper clothes and bowed to the Buddha. He said to him: At that time, what meritorious deed did Mahāprajāpaṇḍika think it was that brought this city of the four kinds of treasure so greatly adorned with offerings from one place to another?

source_sentence: 及獲四明月珠？
translation: And they'll attain the four bright moon pearls?

source_sentence: 眾寶隨之。」
translation: The many treasures follow them.

source_sentence: 佛言：「乃昔惟衛佛世，大意嘗以四寶為佛起塔，供養三尊、持齋七日。
translation: The Buddha said, In the past, Vaiśravaṇa had a great intention to build a stūpa of the four treasures for the Buddha in order to honor the three honored ones and observe purification for seven days.

source_sentence: 是時，有五百人同時共起寺，或懸繒然燈者、或燒香散花者、或供養比丘僧者、或誦經講道者，
translation: At the time, there were five hundred people who all built a temple together at the same time, some hanging banners and lanterns, some burning incense and scattering flowers, some making offerings to monks and nuns, and some reciting scriptures and teaching the Way.

source_sentence: 今皆來會此。」
translation: Now, they'll all come here.

source_sentence: 阿難及四輩弟子，聞經歡喜，前為佛作禮。
translation: Ānanda and the four groups of his disciples were delighted to hear the sutra. They bowed to the Buddha in front of them.

source_sentence: 佛說大意經
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra
